column2: The Old Cold Store, Queensbridge Road, Nottingham, UK
column8: Sound System, Projector
column15:
The Old Cold Store gets its name from its former line of service to the brewery ‚Äì a large storage area for keeping beer cold! Thanks to expansion, the Old Cold Store is now an industrial and minimalist function facility available for private hire. It is ideally located just a short stroll from Nottingham station.
Essentially a supersized blank canvas, the Old Cold Store has a reputation for live music events thanks to its work with Revolution Sounds (formally of the Maze) and Rat Cat. Complete with a private, full-sized bar, this huge area can be organised to your liking and is suitable for a range of events including wedding receptions and corporate meetings.
The Castle Rock Team Party is held here every year, and the space is put to good use for Castle Rock‚Äôs annual Yard Party.
		Sound system
		Projector
		Free WiFi
		Plasma TV
		Dining and buffet packages available

column15:
Since it‚Äôs inception in 1996, The Head of Steam Newcastle has cemented itself as a firm favourite in Newcastle.¬†Situated right across from Newcastle Central Station.
The Head of Steam Newcastle has gained notoriety for hosting the best in up-to-the-minute¬†music. Combining both the venues welcoming atmosphere and warm surroundings with an emphasis on musical brilliance the Head of Steam Newcastle has proved a popular breeding ground for talent.
Offering The Head of Steam‚Äôs celebrated selection of exceptional local craft beer and real ale as well as boasting breweries from all around the world, an array of cocktails, spirits and environmentally conscious wine as well as hot drinks.
